hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >5% intraday price spike on negative macro news (US budget, regulatory headlines) with >50% increase in volume but <15% increase in futures open interest, price will revert 70% of the spike within 48 hours as liquidity providers fade the emotional move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven spikes often represent emotional retail reactions rather than structural liquidity changes. When OI doesn't confirm volume, it suggests weak institutional participation. Market makers fade these moves as they represent temporary liquidity gaps.
entry_conditions: Futures OI change <15% of volume spike
Negative macro news headline within 2 hours of spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 70% of the initial spike
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes new high above spike +1%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such spikes lead to continuation rather than reversion over 48h timeframe
